- From north or south, 91 North or South. Exits for Windsor explicit. 

From east or west, 84 East or West. Exits for Windsor Explicit
- Amtrak stop in Windsor, Hartford, and Windsor Locks.
- Peterpan and Greyhound buses stop in Hartford.
- Bradley International Airport located in Windsor Locks. Taxis available.
CT public transportation is marginally reliable. If coming from out of town, it's best to have your own car or rent one.

value: -a museum focusing on the history and development of communication and broadcast from Morse Code to the World Wide Web. Kid friendly. Located only a mile from the center of town.
-museum located in the home of one of Windsor’s founding fathers. Quiet and quaint, located on Town Green.
- A nice place to enjoy a quiet read. Visit their website for weekly activities for children and adult education.

- Located in Poquonock, park is great for hikes, walks, bike rides. Small farm to enjoy watching animals. Kid-friendly museum to explore Connecticut’s wildlife. Pavilion and grills available until dark.
- Open to visitors after school and practice hours. Track in new condition. Indoor pool, outdoor pool seasonal. Baseball, Lacross, Football, and Soccer fields available.

- Located nearly across the street from Bart’s. Slightly hidden, driveway more like a circle, located on Palisado Ave. Gorgeous paved trails. Best before or after Spring, season flooding affects trains.
- Located on town green approximately from late December to mid-March (weather permitting). Small outdoor rink, family friendly.
Supermarket--family owned grocery located in the center of town.
- less expensive supermarket located near Hartford town line.
-A great hometown diner open for breakfast and lunch. Located in the center of town. Family oriented and fairly inexpensive, continental breakfasts and deli lunches.

- Another hometown diner open for breakfast and lunch. Located in the center of town. “Windsor” themed and great for history buffs. Named after the railroad station located behind restaurant. Continental breakfasts and deli lunches.

- 1950’s themed drive-in restaurant in historic Windsor. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner served. Breakfasts include omelette's and breakfast sandwiches, lunch and dinner offer hamburgers, hotdogs, french fries, and various fried sea food.
- Italian restaurant, classy family sit-down dining. Pizza, pastas, various meats. Located in Poquonuck. Often venue for fundraisers, so check out ahead of time for family fun nights, etc.
- Average sit-down diner. Offers a menu with a large variety for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Kids friendly, offers crayons and children’ menus.

- A less kid family restaurant, classy and somewhat along the lines of an 			Olive Garden. Offers indoor and outdoor dining. Sit-down bar and lounge. A more adult-geared menu of Italian up-scaled meals; seafood, veal, pastas, club sandwiches, gourmet salads.
- Sit down diner, more family friendly than Tunxis Grill. A long time 			Windsor establishment. Menu mainly Italian pastas and various pizzas. Also offers delivery. Coupons available online.
- offers both dining and comprehensive bar. Frequent Happy Hour and late night 		specials.
- Sport’s bar with walls of televisions for optimal viewing. Offers 		frequent game-day/night specials.
address=1 Day Hill Road , Windsor, Connecticut 06095
content=Located right off Interstate 91 in the suburbs of Hartford.
